intents.patterns: At what age can a woman get pregnant?
responses: From the moment she has her first ovulation, which occurs before her first period. Therefore, if a woman has unprotected intercourse, even without her first period, she can get pregnant.
context_set: They are popular beliefs that people have with the conviction that they help them prevent a pregnancy, but they are not really effective or scientifically based.

intents.patterns: If a man ejaculates at the entrance of the vagina, can a woman get pregnant?
responses: Yes, there is a possibility of pregnancy because even if the ejaculate has stayed at the entrance of the vagina, some sperm can reach the egg.

intents.patterns: Is giving birth to a woman under the age of 16 dangerous?
responses: Yes, pregnancy in adolescents is considered high risk and alterations or diseases such as hypertension, anemia, nutritional complications, low birth weight of the fetus at birth, premature birth and complications during childbirth are more frequent in them. When the mother is an adolescent, it is more common for the newborn to become ill or die during the first year of life.

intents.patterns: At what age does semen appear?
responses: Semen appears during puberty between approximately 11 and 13 years of age. It is a fluid that contains spermatozoa and is expelled from the penis during ejaculation.

intents.patterns: What is the normal size of the penis?
responses: The size of the penis in a flaccid relaxed state ranges from three to four inches. The size of the penis in an erect state can be between 12 and 17 centimeters. It is important to note that when the penis is erect it can bend or triple its size, although this depends on the race and the physical structure of the man.

intents.patterns: Why can you also get a Sexually Transmitted Infection (STI) through anal and oral sex?
responses: The anus, vagina, and mouth are mucous membranes, tissues that are very sensitive to infection, disease, and/or injury. If the genitals of the person with whom you are having oral or anal intercourse are infected with some virus or bacteria will pass them on to your partner. The only way to prevent a Sexually Transmitted Infection is with the proper use of condoms in all sexual relations, be it vaginal, oral or anal.

intents.patterns: Can you have oral and anal sex?
